definitions.definition: To attribute (a cause or characteristic ) to someone or something.
examples: One may ascribe these problems to the federal government; however, at this stage it is unclear what caused them.

definitions.definition: To attribute (a book , painting , or any other work of art or literature ) to a writer or creator .
examples: It is arguable as to whether we can truly ascribe this play to Shakespeare.

definitions.definition: To believe in or agree with; to subscribe .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To attribute (a cause or characteristic ) to someone or something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To attribute (a book , painting , or any other work of art or literature ) to a writer or creator .
( nonstandard , with to ) To believe in or agree with; to subscribe .
